org.jredis.ri.alphazero
Class JRedisClient

java.lang.Object
  org.jredis.ri.alphazero.JRedisSupport
      org.jredis.ri.alphazero.JRedisClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
JRedis
public class JRedisClient
extends JRedisSupport

A basic client, using SocketConnection and handler delegate

This class is simply an assembly of various other components that address distinct concerns of a JRedis connection, and effectively defines the connection policy and use-case patterns by selecting this set of cooperating elements.

This is a simple client object suitable for long-held open connections to a redis server by single threaded applications.

The components that are used ARE NOT thread-safe and assume synchronised/sequential access to the api defined by JRedis. Both the connection and protocol handler delegates of this class are intended for use by a single thread, or strictly sequential access by a pool of threads. You can create multiple instances of this class and use dedicated threads for each to create a service (if you wish).

Connection management issues are handled by the SocketConnection delegate and you should read the docs for that class for details of its operations. But as far as JRedis support is concerned, a call to JRedis.quit() or JRedis.shutdown() will close the connections and subsequent calls to the interface will prompt the throwing of an exception.

Redis protocol is handled by a Protocol instance obtained from the ProtocolManager. This class will by default specify the RedisVersion.current_revision.

Since:
alpha.0
Version:
alpha.0, 04/02/09
Author:
Joubin Houshyar (alphazero@sensesay.net)

JRedisClient

public JRedisClient(java.lang.String host,
                    int port,
                    RedisVersion redisVersion)
             throws ClientRuntimeException
Creates a new instance of RedisClient, using the information provided.

This constructor will delegate all Protocol issues to a SocketConnection instance, for which it will obtain a Protocol handler delegate from ProtocolManager for the user specified redis version

All specifics regarding the implementation of the JRedis contract are handled by the superclass and you should consult that class's documentation for the detailss.

Parameters:
host -
port -
redisVersion -
Throws:
ClientRuntimeException
